intro: Philgamia denticulata, commonly known as the toothed filaree, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small annual herb with delicate, fern-like leaves and produces clusters of tiny, white flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its scientific name reflects the toothed margins of its leaves, which are a distinguishing feature. Philgamia denticulata is part of the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its short life cycle.
